New Records: Shubman Gill scored 126* off 63 balls, the highest score in the match.
Hardik Pandya was the Player of the Series, leading India to a 2-1 series victory.
Ben Lister made his T20I debut in this match.
Key Match Events: India scored 234/4 in 20 overs, with Shubman Gill and Rahul Tripathi contributing significantly.
New Zealand struggled with 66/10 in 12.1 overs, facing strong bowling from India.
The match was a dominant performance by India, with a 168-run victory.
Pre-Game Insights: India elected to bat first after winning the toss.
The match was the third and final T20I of the New Zealand tour of India.
Post-Match Reflections: Shubman Gill was named Player of the Match for his outstanding performance.
The series victory marked a significant milestone for India in T20 cricket.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was held at Narendra Modi Stadium, Ahmedabad.
It was the 1992nd T20I match in history.
Others: The umpires for the match included Jayaraman Madanagopal, Nitin Menon, and Anil Chaudhary.
